revised_title: Elephants Teeth and Bones Found Under Ground: A Study on Fossil Remains
tldr: This article discusses the discovery of elephant teeth and bones found underground and examines their structure, composition, and the effects of fossilization. The author, Sir Hans Sloane, describes various specimens and their properties, including the layers of structure in the teeth, which resemble the growth rings in tree trunks. The article also explores the use of these fossilized remains in medicine and their cultural significance.
